definition: to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work

sentences.english: Although lampoon, but everybody have no complaint.
sentences.chinese: 雖疲於奔命，但大家都毫無怨言。

sentences.english: Cold or heat, for the pollen, exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 嚴寒或酷暑時，爲着花粉，疲於奔命。

sentences.english: This guerrilla detachment which mysteriously appeared and disappeared kept the invaders constantly on the run.
sentences.chinese: 這支神出鬼沒的游擊隊搞得侵略者疲於奔命。

definition: (idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
the wolf runs and the wild boar rushes (idiom); crowds of evil-doers mill around like wild beasts
to run/to rush about/to be on the go
to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
in a panic/flurried
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
see 無頭蒼蠅|无头苍蝇[wu2 tou2 cang1 ying5]
fatigued/exhausted/poverty-stricken/in straitened circumstances
